topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Applying the ESX Compute Proxy Patch

p.i: Return to the the KVM + ESX installation.

section.p:
This patch fixes an intermittent issue where the ESX compute proxy is not configured after the hprovision completes successfully. The patch increase the timeout to allow enough time for the proxy VM to boot.
Log into the lifecycle manager host.
Copy the compute_proxy_patch_1.1.tar.gz to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory.
Use the following command to extract the compute_proxy_patch_1.1.tar.gz: tar -zxvf compute_proxy_patch_1.1.tar.gz
Use the following command to install the Ubuntu patch utility:apt-get install patch
Change to the ~/cg-hlm directory:cd ~/cg-hlm
You can confirm that the patch will execute properly before performing the patch operation by executing the following command:patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion_1.1/ compute-proxy-timeout.patch
The command shoild result in the following message:checking file node-provision/hlm_provisionproxy.py
Execute the following command to perform tha patching operation: patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion_1.1/ compute-proxy-timeout.patchThe patch application returns the following message, if successful: patching file node-provision/hlm_provisionproxy.py
Change to the ~/cg-hlm/hlm-build folder:cd ~/cg-hlm/hlm-build
Execute the following command to synch the patch file:./hlm_prepare-env.sh

body.p: Return to the the KVM + ESX installation.
